posts.post_content:
[Consult the Necrosages](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consult the Necrosages) until they have no hand! Then [Mind Funeral](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Funeral) a few times! Then steal their creatures with [Dimir Doppelganger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dimir Doppelganger)!  
  
They will cry all the way home.  
  
I've also had fun (with the preconstructed Dimir Intrigues deck) using this to force the opponent to top-deck, then only allowing them to draw cards I permit through [Lurking Informant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lurking Informant).
posts.html:
Consult the Necrosages until they have no hand! Then Mind Funeral a few times! Then steal their creatures with Dimir Doppelganger!

They will cry all the way home.

I've also had fun (with the preconstructed Dimir Intrigues deck) using this to force the opponent to top-deck, then only allowing them to draw cards I permit through Lurking Informant.

posts.post_content:
I'm inventing a format where this card and other Dimir cards will really shine. It's called "My Friends Have Terrible Cards." In this format, you can count on your play group to use a hodge-podge assortment of booster packs and hand-me-downs. You have the luxury to play under-powered milling cards that are kinda gimmicky and silly. And because the overall power level of the format is so low, you still win a consistent number of games (40% or so).  
  
If this format sounds fun to you, we're playing on Thursday. Remember, no cohesive decks. You can bring your rogue deck, but it mush include a full playset of [Amphin Cutthroat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amphin Cutthroat) and [Krovikan Scoundrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krovikan Scoundrel).
posts.html:
I'm inventing a format where this card and other Dimir cards will really shine. It's called "My Friends Have Terrible Cards." In this format, you can count on your play group to use a hodge-podge assortment of booster packs and hand-me-downs. You have the luxury to play under-powered milling cards that are kinda gimmicky and silly. And because the overall power level of the format is so low, you still win a consistent number of games (40% or so).

If this format sounds fun to you, we're playing on Thursday. Remember, no cohesive decks. You can bring your rogue deck, but it mush include a full playset of Amphin Cutthroat and Krovikan Scoundrel.
